Package javelin.controller.map

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.map.Map
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Caves, Complex, DndMap, LocationMap, Shore, TownMap, Ziggurat
    public abstract class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    Representation of a battle area.
    Author:
    alex

        Represents an Square.obstructed item.

        Used often as an obstacle.

        Represents Square.flooded.

      • map

        public Square[][] map
        Two-dimensional array of squares. map[point.x][point.y]

      • maxflooding

        public int maxflooding
        See Weather. By default allows any extent of flooding.

      • name

        public java.lang.String name
        Map title.

      • standard

        public boolean standard
        Maps that are supposed to be good for any minigame or situation.
        See Also:
        random()

      • startingareablue

        public java.util.ArrayList<Point> startingareablue
        Possible starting positions for the player team. If empty, will be ignored.

      • startingareared

        public java.util.ArrayList<Point> startingareared
        Same as startingareablue but for enemies.

      • flying

        public boolean flying
        Usually true but confined spaces where flyers cannot fly over walls will be false. This is done for consistency but mostly because it allows for the BattleAi to just stay out of reach with flying creatures instead of losing a fight. Dungeon maps for example can have wall placement that makes it very hard to kill a flying unit unless you have one yourself.
        See Also:
        Monster.fly

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        public Map​(java.lang.String namep,
           int width,
           int height)
        Construcor based on map size. By default all Squares are completely free.

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        public abstract void generate()
        Creates the map. Called after construction to allow for fast instantiation of a Maps list and lazy generation operation.
